words.definition: If something is done on one's behalf, it is done for that person by another.
words.example: The lawyer spoke on behalf of his client.

words.definition: To flap means to move quickly up and down or from side to side.
words.example: The bird flapped its wings and flew away.

words.definition: A glacier is a large move of ice that moves very slowly.
words.example: The glacier is slowly melting due to global warming.

words.definition: The globe is the Earth.
words.example: Water covers most of the globe.

words.definition: When something is horizontal, it is flat and level with the ground.
words.example: The teacher drew a horizontal line on the board.

words.definition: To hum means to make a low continuous sound.
words.example: The refrigerator began to hum loudly.

words.definition: An inventory is a detailed list of all the things in a place.
words.example: The store owner kept an inventory of all the items he sold.

words.definition: If something is inward, it is directed toward the inside.
words.example: She took an inward breath to calm herself down.

words.definition: A loaf is bread shaped and baked as a single piece.
words.example: He bought a loaf of fresh bread from the bakery.

words.definition: An oracle is a person who speaks for a god and can see the future.
words.example: The king went to the oracle to ask about the war.

words.definition: To orbit something means to move around it in a continuous curve.
words.example: The moon orbits the Earth.

words.definition: An overview is a general description or summary of something.
words.example: The professor gave us an overview of the course syllabus.

words.definition: A preview is an opportunity to see something before it is shown to the public.
words.example: We saw a preview of the new movie.

words.definition: If something is previous, it happened before a certain time or event.
words.example: I had met him on a previous occasion.

words.definition: To provide something means to supply it.
words.example: The company provides health insurance for its employees.

words.definition: To recur means to happen or appear again.
words.example: The problem has recurred several times this month.

words.definition: If something is relevant, it is important to what is being discussed.
words.example: His comments were relevant to the topic of the meeting.

words.definition: A rite is a traditional ceremony for a particular group.
words.example: The graduation ceremony is a rite of passage for students.

words.definition: To stall means to stop making progress or to stop moving.
words.example: The car stalled in the middle of the road.

words.definition: If something is supernatural, it is not explained by the laws of nature.
words.example: Ghosts are considered supernatural beings.
